members.desc: provides the dcr:datacat and dcr:ValueDatacat attributes which are used to align XML elements or attributes with the appropriate Data Categories (DCs) defined by the ISO 12620:2009 standard and stored in the Web repository called ISOCat at http://www.isocat.org/.

attributes.desc: contains a PID (persistent identifier) that aligns the given element with the appropriate Data Category (or categories) in ISOcat.
contains a PID (persistent identifier) that aligns the content of the given element or the value of the given attribute with the appropriate simple Data Category (or categories) in ISOcat.

members.desc: provides attributes common to all elements in the TEI encoding scheme.

attributes.desc: (identifier) provides a unique identifier for the element bearing the attribute.
(number) gives a number (or other label) for an element, which is not necessarily unique within the document.
(language) indicates the language of the element content using a tag generated according to BCP 47.
(rendition) indicates how the element in question was rendered or presented in the source text.
contains an expression in some formal style definition language which defines the rendering or presentation used for this element in the source text
points to a description of the rendering or presentation used for this element in the source text.
provides a base URI reference with which applications can resolve relative URI references into absolute URI references.
signals an intention about how white space should be managed by applications.

members.desc: (bi-conditional feature-structure constraint) defines a biconditional feature-structure constraint; both consequent and antecedent are specified as feature structures or groups of feature structures; the constraint is satisfied if both subsume a given feature structure, or if both do not.
(binary value) represents the value part of a feature-value specification which can contain either of exactly two possible values.

attributes.desc: supplies a binary value.

members.desc: (conditional feature-structure constraint) defines a conditional feature-structure constraint; the consequent and the antecedent are specified as feature structures or feature-structure collections; the constraint is satisfied if both the antecedent and the consequent subsume a given feature structure, or if the antecedent does not.
(default feature value) represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains a defaulted value.
(feature) represents a feature value specification, that is, the association of a name with a value of any of several different types.

attributes.desc: a single word which follows the rules defining a legal XML name (see ), providing a name for the feature.
(feature value) references any element which can be used to represent the value of a feature.

members.desc: (feature declaration) declares a single feature, specifying its name, organization, range of allowed values, and optionally its default value.

attributes.desc: a single word which follows the rules defining a legal XML name (see ), indicating the name of the feature being declared; matches the name attribute of f elements in the text.
indicates whether or not the value of this feature may be present.

members.desc: (feature description (in FSD)) describes in prose what is represented by the feature being declared and its values.
(feature library) assembles a library of feature elements.
(feature structure) represents a feature structure, that is, a collection of feature-value pairs organized as a structural unit.

attributes.desc: specifies the type of the feature structure.
(features) references the feature-value specifications making up this feature structure.

members.desc: (feature-structure constraints) specifies constraints on the content of valid feature structures.
(feature structure declaration) declares one type of feature structure.

attributes.desc: gives a name for the type of feature structure being declared.

gives the name of one or more typed feature structures from which this type inherits feature specifications and constraints; if this type includes a feature specification with the same name as that of any of those specified by this attribute, or if more than one specification of the same name is inherited, then the set of possible values is defined by unification. Similarly, the set of constraints applicable is derived by combining those specified explicitly within this element with those implied by the baseTypes attribute. When no baseTypes attribute is specified, no feature specification or constraint is inherited.

members.desc: (feature system description (in FSD)) describes in prose what is represented by the type of feature structure declared in the enclosing fsDecl.
(feature system declaration) provides a feature system declaration comprising one or more feature structure declarations or feature structure declaration links.
(feature structure declaration link) associates the name of a typed feature structure with a feature structure declaration for it.

attributes.desc: identifies the type of feature structure to be documented; this will be the value of the type attribute on at least one feature structure.
supplies a pointer to a feature structure declaration (fsDecl) element within the current document or elsewhere.

members.desc: (feature-value library) assembles a library of reusable feature value elements (including complete feature structures).
defines a conditional default value for a feature; the condition is specified as a feature structure, and is met if it subsumes the feature structure in the text for which a default value is sought.
(if and only if) separates the condition from the consequence in a bicond element.
(numeric value) represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains a numeric value or range.

attributes.desc: supplies a lower bound for the numeric value represented, and also (if max is not supplied) its upper bound.
supplies an upper bound for the numeric value represented.
specifies whether the value represented should be truncated to give an integer value.

members.desc: (string value) represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains a string.
(symbolic value) represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains one of a finite list of symbols.

attributes.desc: supplies a symbolic value for the feature, one of a finite list that may be specified in a feature declaration.

members.desc: separates the condition from the default in an if, or the antecedent and the consequent in a cond element.
(value alternation) represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains a set of values, only one of which can be valid.
(collection of values) represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains multiple values organized as a set, bag, or list.

attributes.desc: (organization) indicates organization of given value or values as set, bag or list.

members.desc: (value default) declares the default value to be supplied when a feature structure does not contain an instance of f for this name; if unconditional, it is specified as one (or, depending on the value of the org attribute of the enclosing fDecl) more fs elements or primitive values; if conditional, it is specified as one or more if elements; if no default is specified, or no condition matches, the value none is assumed.
(value label) represents the value part of a feature-value specification which appears at more than one point in a feature structure.

attributes.desc: supplies a name identifying the sharing point.

members.desc: (merged collection of values) represents a feature value which is the result of merging together the feature values contained by its children, using the organization specified by the org attribute.

attributes.desc: indicates the organization of the resulting merged values as set, bag or list.

members.desc: (value negation) represents a feature value which is the negation of its content.

(value range) defines the range of allowed values for a feature, in the form of an fs, vAlt, or primitive value; for the value of an f to be valid, it must be subsumed by the specified range; if the f contains multiple values (as sanctioned by the org attribute), then each value must be subsumed by the vRange.

modelclasses.desc: groups elements used to represent a postal or e-mail address.
groups elements containing a bibliographic description.
groups elements containing temporal expressions.
groups paragraph-level elements appearing directly within divisions.
groups elements containing examples or illustrations.
groups phrase-level elements which are typographically distinct and to which a specific function can be attributed.
groups elements which represent feature values in feature structures.
groups elements which express complex feature values in feature structures.
group elements used to represent atomic feature values in feature structures.
groups elements used to represent individual non-Unicode characters or glyphs.
groups elements which may appear at any point within a TEI text.
groups globally available elements which perform a specifically editorial function.
groups globally available elements which describe the status of other elements.
groups elements containing images, formulae, and similar objects.
groups phrase-level elements which are typographically distinct but to which no specific function can be attributed.
groups phrase-level elements which are typographically distinct.
groups elements which can appear either within or between paragraph-like elements.
groups elements representing metrical components such as verse lines.
groups phrase-level elements which may appear within verse only.
groups elements used to gloss or explain other parts of a document.
groups phrase-level elements excluding those elements primarily intended for transcription of existing sources.
groups list-like elements.
groups elements which denote a number, a quantity, a measurement, or similar piece of text that conveys some numerical meaning.
groups milestone-style elements used to represent reference systems.
groups elements which name or refer to a person, place, or organization.
groups elements which contain names of individuals or corporate bodies.
groups globally-available note-like elements.
groups elements which generate declarations in some markup language in ODD documents.
groups elements which can appear only as part of a place name.
groups paragraph-like elements.
groups phrase-level elements containing names, dates, numbers, measures, and similar data.
groups phrase-level elements for simple editorial correction and transcription.
groups phrase-level elements for simple editorial interventions that may be useful both in transcribing and in authoring.
groups phrase-level elements used in manuscript description.
groups phrase-level elements used for editorial transcription of pre-existing source materials.
groups elements which can occur at the level of individual words or phrases.
groups phrase-level elements used to encode XML constructs such as element names, attribute names, and attribute values
groups elements which form part of a place name.
groups elements which describe changing states of a place.
groups elements used for purposes of location and reference.
groups elements related to highlighting which can appear either within or between chunk-level elements.
groups elements used to directly contain quotations.
groups elements used for arbitrary segmentation.
groups elements for referring to specification elements.
groups elements containing stage directions or similar things defined by the module for performance texts.

macros.desc: defines the range of attribute values expressing a degree of certainty.
defines the range of attribute values used for a non-negative integer value used as a count.
defines the range of attribute values available for representation of a duration in time using ISO 8601 standard formats
defines the range of attribute values available for representation of a duration in time using W3C datatypes.
defines the range of attribute values expressed as a single XML name taken from a list of documented possibilities.
defines the range of attribute values used to identify a particular combination of human language and writing system.
defines the range of attribute values expressed as an XML Name.
defines the range of attribute values used for numeric values.
defines a range of values for use in specifying the size of an object that is intended for display.
defines the range of attribute values used to provide a single URI, absolute or relative, pointing to some other resource, either within the current document or elsewhere.
defines the range of attribute values expressing a probability.
defines the range of attribute values expressing a temporal expression such as a date, a time, or a combination of them, that conform to the W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes specification.
defines the range of attribute values used to express some kind of identifying string as a single sequence of unicode characters possibly including whitespace.
defines the range of attribute values used to express a truth value.
defines the range of attribute values used for version numbers.
defines the range of attribute values expressed as a single word or token.
(extended truth value) defines the range of attribute values used to express a truth value which may be unknown.
(paragraph content) defines the content of prose elements that are not used for transcription of extant materials.
(extended text) defines a sequence of character data and gaiji elements.
